```{r}
plotDelaunay <- function(sfe, cluster){
    celltype.coords <- spatialCoords(sfe)[colData(sfe)[[cluster]],]
    
    tri <- interp::tri.mesh(x=celltype.coords[,1],
                        y=celltype.coords[,2])
    #print(summary(tri))

    tri.df <- as.data.frame(cbind(x=tri$x, y=tri$y))
    p <- plotGeometry(sfe, type="cellSeg")+
        ggforce::geom_delaunay_segment(data=tri.df, aes(x=x, y=y), colour="blue")
    return(list(p=p, tri=tri))
}

```

```{r}
delaunayAdjacencyMatrix <- function(sfe, tri){
    # get the x and y indices of the spatial coordinates that are in the triangulation
    x.inds <- which(spatialCoords(br6471_p)[,1]%in%tri$x)
    y.inds <- which(spatialCoords(br6471_p)[,2]%in%tri$y)
    
    # find the intersecting x and y indices, these are the coordinates that are actually 
    # in the triangulation
    celltype.inds <- intersect(x.inds, y.inds)
    
    # get the ids of the cells in the triangulation 
    cell_ids <- sfe$cell_id[celltype.inds]
    
    # get the adjacency matrix for the triangulation
    adj <- get.adjacency(graph.edgelist(as.matrix(interp::arcs(tri)), directed=FALSE))
    
    # add the cell ids to the column and rownames
    dimnames(adj) <- list(cell_ids, cell_ids)
    
    return(adj)
}
```

```{r}
getEdgesSpatialDistance <- function(sfe, adj){
    # build the graph
    g <- graph_from_adjacency_matrix(adj)

    # provide the x and y cell centroids for each cell 
    inds <- which(sfe$cell_id %in% V(g)$name)
    V(g)$x_coords <- spatialCoords(sfe)[,1][inds]
    V(g)$y_coords <- spatialCoords(sfe)[,2][inds]
    
    # get the edgelist to easily compute distances 
    el <- get.edgelist(g)
    
    
    # make a coordinates dataframe that's easier to query
    coords_df <- as.data.frame(cbind(name=V(g)$name, 
                       x=V(g)$x_coords, 
                       y=V(g)$y_coords))
    
    # Find the coordinates of the first vertex for each edge
    start_coords <- coords_df %>%
        filter(name %in% el[,1])
    # Match the order of the coordinates to the order that they appear in the edgelist 
    start_coords <- start_coords[match(el[,1], start_coords$name),]
    
    # Do the same for the second vertex of each edge
    end_coords <- coords_df %>%
        filter(name %in% el[,2])
    
    end_coords <- end_coords[match(el[,2], end_coords$name),]
    
    # Compute the length (euclidean distance) for each edge
    
    dists <- sqrt((as.numeric(start_coords$x) -     as.numeric(end_coords$x))^2 + 
                      (as.numeric(start_coords$y) - as.numeric(end_coords$y))^2)
    #print(dists)
    
    # save the lengths as the edge weights
    E(g)$weight <- dists
    
    return(g)
    
}
```

```{r}
    # get the edge lengths
    gdist <- getEdgesSpatialDistance(br6471_p, adj)
    
    # plot the histogram of the edge lengths
    weight.df <- data.frame(weight=E(gdist)$weight)
    
    h <- ggplot(weight.df, aes(x=weight))+
        geom_histogram(bins=50)+
        xlab("Edge lengths")
    print(p + h)
    
}
```

```{r}
compute_global_edge_constraint <- function(g, vertex){
    # compute the global edge constraint for a single vertex detailed in https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0098300411004419#s0010
    # compute the global edge length mean and variation
    global_mean <- mean(E(g)$weight)
    global_variation <- sd(E(g)$weight)
    
    # get the vertex's edge length to its neighbours
    incident.els <- incident(g, vertex)$weight
    #print(incident.els)
    #print(nn)
    
    local_mean <- mean(incident.els)
    #print(local_mean)
    
    alpha <- global_mean/local_mean
    
    global_constraint <- global_mean + alpha*global_variation
    
    return(global_constraint)
}
```
